etymology.description: semantic: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic: 丂(丂) (kǎo) = reference to exhaled air "to sing" -> capability to perform actions
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the semantic element 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") with the phonetic 丂(丂) (kǎo), referencing exhaling or vocal actions like singing, which suggests expressing capability or permission.

examples.chinese: 你可尝试一下新方法(你可嘗試一下新方法)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kě chángshì yīxià xīn fāngfǎ.
examples.english: You may try a new method.

examples.chinese: 此事虽难(此事雖難)，你可坚持到底(你可堅持到底)。
examples.pinyin: Cǐ shì suī nán, nǐ kě jiānchí dàodǐ.
examples.english: Although this matter is difficult, you may persist to the end.
